item.title: An acclaimed Apple critic made up the details | Marketplace from American Public Media
item.description: For the record, I have always suspected that many stories on 'This American Life' were a little too perfect. http://t.co/PkGX8j8w
item.content:encoded: For the record, I have always suspected that many stories on 'This American Life' were a little too perfect. http://t.co/PkGX8j8w The monologist Mike Daisey’s account of Chinese factory conditions in “The Agony and Ecstasy of Steve Jobs” made people think differently about their iPhones and iPads. But after an adaptation aired on This American Life, reaching China, an investigation there of his allegations found they were fabricated. Given other news reports on the conditions, will that matter? Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: marketplace.org

item.title: Retracting "Mr. Daisey and the Apple Factory" | This American Life
item.description: "We're horrified to have let something like this onto public radio … numerous … significant fabrications …" http://t.co/BMhnGMZz #daiseygate
item.content:encoded: "We're horrified to have let something like this onto public radio … numerous … significant fabrications …" http://t.co/BMhnGMZz #daiseygate Ira writes: I have difficult news. We've learned that Mike Daisey's story about Apple in China - which we broadcast in January - contained significant fabrications. We're retracting the story because we can’t vouch for its truth. This is not a story we commissioned. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thisamericanlife.org

item.title: Retraction | This American Life
item.description: Here's the big news of the day: most of Mike Daisey's This American Life episode is a lie. He cooked it. http://t.co/F2SfG8gD
item.content:encoded: Here's the big news of the day: most of Mike Daisey's This American Life episode is a lie. He cooked it. http://t.co/F2SfG8gD Regrettably, we have discovered that one of our most popular episodes was partially fabricated. This week, we devote the entire hour to detailing the errors in "Mr. Daisey Goes to the Apple Factory," Mike Daisey’s story about visiting Foxconn, an Apple supplier factory in China. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thisamericanlife.org

item.title: Anti-Rush Campaign Was in the Works « Commentary Magazine
item.description: How did the Left build its campaign against @RushLimbaugh so quickly, so effectively? http://t.co/X7f7TDE6
item.content:encoded: How did the Left build its campaign against @RushLimbaugh so quickly, so effectively? http://t.co/X7f7TDE6 Wonder how the left was able to mobilize so quickly on the Rush Limbaugh boycott? According to the architect behind it, Media Matters online strategy director Angelo Carusone, the project was actually created in 2009, but stayed inactive until the Sandra Fluke controversy boiled over (via Legal Insurrection): Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: commentarymagazine.com

item.title: Texas Loses Entire Women's Health Program Over Planned Parenthood Law
item.description: For chrissake, secede already.... http://t.co/OYvHzzV9
item.content:encoded: For chrissake, secede already.... http://t.co/OYvHzzV9 The Department of Health and Human Services announced on Thursday that it will cut off all Medicaid funding for family planning to the state of Texas, following Gov. Rick Perry's (R) decision to implement a new law that excludes Planned Parenthood from the state's Medicaid Women's Health Program. Cindy Mann, director of the Center for Medicaid and State Operations (CMSO), wrote Texas health officials a letter on Thursday explaining that the state broke federal Medicaid rules by discriminating against qualified family planning providers and thus would be losing the entire program, which provides cancer screenings, contraceptives and basic health care to 130,000 low-income women each year. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: George Clooney Arrested: Actor And Congressmen In Custody After Protest Outside Sudanese Embassy
item.description: George Clooney ARRESTED in Washington D.C. http://t.co/O9HPLNJM
item.content:encoded: George Clooney ARRESTED in Washington D.C. http://t.co/O9HPLNJM George Clooney and at least one congressman were arrested Friday outside of the Sudanese embassy in Washington D.C. The arrests were anticipated and part of the actor's effort to draw attention to the humanitarian crisis in Sudan. The actor, his father and politicians were protesting the country's blockade of supplies and humanitarian aide. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com
